intro: Hypocalymma angustifolium f. acerosum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hypocalymma, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming in spring. It is adapted to grow in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or near-coastal regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
